Class Glossary

java.lang.Object
Glossary
public class Glossary
extends java.lang.Object
Glossary is a class meant to contain an English-French technical glossary.
Version:
1.4
Author:
Jean-Camille LAPIERRE, Dorian MOUNIER, Gabriel SAPONARA, Cyril PIGEYRE, Medhy DOHOU

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Glossary()
    A constructor for the Glossary class, which intialize an empty List<Word>
    Glossary​(java.util.List<Word> glossary)
    Create a new Glossary object, with the glossary

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addWordGlossary​(Word word)
    Add a word to the glossary, and sort it again using the method sortByEn
    void addWordStringOnly​(java.lang.String englishWord, java.lang.String frenchWord)
    Same method as addWordGlossary, except it takes strings as an input rather than a Word object.
    java.util.List<Word> getGlossary()
    Glossary getter.
    int numberOfPages()
    Returns the number of pages of the glossary.
    java.util.List<Word> pages​(int startPage, int endPage)
    Returns all the words of the glossary between startPage (included) and endPage (included) parameters.
    java.util.List<Word> pagesMandatory​(int startPage, int endPage)
    Returns only the mandatory words of the glossary between startPage (included) and endPage (included) parameters.
    void removeWord​(Word word)
    Remove the word in the glossary.
    Word search​(java.lang.String keyWord)
    Search through the glossary for the string passed as a parameter, and return all the results.
    void sortByEn()
    Sort glossary by lexical order using english words.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Glossary

      public Glossary​(java.util.List<Word> glossary)
      Create a new Glossary object, with the glossary
      Parameters:
      glossary - : The glossary to contain.

    • Glossary

      public Glossary()
      A constructor for the Glossary class, which intialize an empty List<Word>

  • Method Details

    • sortByEn

      public void sortByEn()
      Sort glossary by lexical order using english words.

    • getGlossary

      public java.util.List<Word> getGlossary()
      Glossary getter.
      Returns:
      An array list with all the words of the glossary.

    • addWordGlossary

      public void addWordGlossary​(Word word)
      Add a word to the glossary, and sort it again using the method sortByEn
      Parameters:
      word - : The word to add into the glossary.

    • addWordStringOnly

      public void addWordStringOnly​(java.lang.String englishWord, java.lang.String frenchWord)
      Same method as addWordGlossary, except it takes strings as an input rather than a Word object.
      Parameters:
      englishWord - : The English word to add (must be a String).
      frenchWord - : The french translation of the word (must be a String).

    • search

      public Word search​(java.lang.String keyWord)
      Search through the glossary for the string passed as a parameter, and return all the results.
      Parameters:
      keyWord - : The word to search (can be either french or english).
      Returns:
      The word that matches, else returns keyWord not found.

    • pages

      public java.util.List<Word> pages​(int startPage, int endPage)
      Returns all the words of the glossary between startPage (included) and endPage (included) parameters.
      Parameters:
      startPage - : First page to return.
      endPage - : Last page to return.
      Returns:
      Content of pages between startPage (included) and endPage (included).

    • pagesMandatory

      public java.util.List<Word> pagesMandatory​(int startPage, int endPage)
      Returns only the mandatory words of the glossary between startPage (included) and endPage (included) parameters.
      Parameters:
      startPage - : First page to return.
      endPage - : Last page to return.
      Returns:
      Content of pages between startPage (included) and endPage (included).

    • numberOfPages

      public int numberOfPages()
      Returns the number of pages of the glossary.
      Returns:
      The number of pages of the glossary.

    • removeWord

      public void removeWord​(Word word)
      Remove the word in the glossary.
      Parameters:
      word - The Word to remove from the glossary.
